data.title: Timeline of AU Athletics
data.text:
February 16, 2017 - Men's indoor track and field claimed two Patriot League Titles in the 4x800m and the 800m (Liam Purdy).

March 4, 2017 - Josh Terao finishes second at the 113th EIWA Championship. Jeric Kasunic and Jason Grimes qualify for NCAA Championship.

March 5, 2017 – Fiona Caulfield heads to the 2017 NCAA Zone A Diving Championships.

March 6, 2017 - Lauren Crisler claims the Corvias Patriot League Women's Basketball Scholar-Athlete of the Year.

April, 2017 – The American University dance team finishes fourth in the Division I Jazz competition at the NDA Collegiate Nationals.

May 1, 2017 - Panos Nakhid (men's soccer) and Natalie Konerth (field hockey) are honored as the Outstanding Male and Female Senior Student-Athletes of the Year at the annual American University Student-Athlete Banquet. Shannon Scovel (swimming) received the Barbara J. Reimann Post-Graduate Scholarship.

May 3, 2017 – Volleyball and women’s cross country/track earn NCAA Public Recognition Awards for being among the top 10 percent of programs nationally in terms of Academic Progress Rate.

May 5, 2017 - Men's outdoor track and field wins the 4x800m at the Patriot League Championships.

Spring, 2017 - Women's swimming senior Shannon Scovel receives the American University President's Award and is awarded a Fulbright Scholarship.

Summer, 2017 – Jacobs Varsity Weight Room undergoes renovations, including branded platforms and advanced lifting racks, which allows strength and conditioning staff the ability to work with more student-athletes.

June 26, 2017 – American University Athletics signs multi-year agreement with Baltimore-based Under Armour to be the official outfitter for all 16 varsity sports.

July 18, 2017 – Adding to her resume as one of AU’s most decorated student-athletes, field hockey’s Natalie Konerth is selected as the Corvias Patriot League Female Scholar-Athlete of the Year. She is the third AU student-athlete to earn the distinction since American joined the PL in 2001. A two-time Patriot League Scholar-Athlete of the Year for field hockey, Konerth graduated from AU in December 2016 with a 4.00 GPA in applied mathematics. Among the many accolades garnered by Konerth in her final year as an Eagle were a CoSIDA Academic At-Large Third Team selection and her second consecutive CoSIDA Academic All-District recognition.

August 3, 2017 – Sean Graham is hired as the head coach of American’s cross country and track and field program, returning to D.C. after previously serving as an assistant from 2009-11.

August 11, 2017 – Men’s basketball embarks on a 10-day, three-game tour of Australia, taking on strong competition in Australia’s premier professional basketball league. In addition to game experience, the Eagles went sightseeing at the Great Barrier Reef and the Kuranda Village Rainforest.

September 18, 2017 – Volleyball hosts exhibition with professional team from Zhejiang, China, a team that has produced a number of players for the Chinese National Team.

October 7, 2017 – Aleksandra Kazala becomes one of 13 volleyball players to reach the 1,000-kill milestone in a three-set win over Lafayette.

October 26, 2017 – Head wrestling coach Teague Moore is selected as the head coach for the U.S. Men's Freestyle Team that will compete in late November at the 2017 Under-23 World Championships in Poland.

October 31, 2017 – Field hockey’s Rafaela Rubas is named as the Patriot League Offensive Player and Noor Coenen earns PL Rookie of the Year.

November 1, 2017 – Maura Jacobs becomes the fourth consecutive American University field hockey player to be selected as the Corvias Patriot League Scholar-Athlete of the Year. She closed the regular season with a league-leading 1.56 goals against average and totaled 46 saves for a .639 save percentage. Jacobs is studying public relations and strategic communication and holds a 3.98 cumulative grade point average (GPA).

November 4, 2017 – Volleyball’s Kennedy Etheridge surpasses 2,000 career assists in win over Lehigh.

November 14, 2017 – Volleyball’s Aleksandra Kazala is named the Patriot League Player of the Year for a second straight season, joining Karla Kucerkova, Rubena Sukaj and Monica Smidova as Eagles who have won the award multiple times. Kristen Largay is named PL Libero of the Year and set a single-match record with 40 digs against Navy (9/26).

November 19, 2017 – The American volleyball team wins its 15th Patriot League title in 17 years with a sweep over Navy in Bender Arena. AU improves to 30-0 in PL tournament matches inside Bender Arena and have won five straight PL titles. The win gives the Eagles 18 straight wins heading into a first-round NCAA matchup with 13th-seeded BYU. AU would fall in three sets to the Cougars in Provo, Utah.

December 2, 2017 – Josh Terao tops three ranked opponents on his way to a runner-up finish at the Cliff Keen Las Vegas Invitational. Jeric Kasunic finishes third, while Michael Sprague also gets on the podium with an eighth-place finish. AU finishes in a program-best 11th place out of 46 teams at the tournament widely considered the toughest in the country outside of the NCAA championships.

December 3, 2017 – Alex Feys of the women’s swim team sets meet record at the ECAC Winter Championships by going 2:03.04 to win the 200-yard butterfly.

December 20, 2017 – Women’s basketball closes out the non-conference slate with a 75-66 upset over Big Ten foe, Penn State. It’s the second time AU has beaten a Big Ten team with the first coming against Maryland on December 30, 1986.

January 20, 2018 – In a halftime ceremony, men’s basketball honors the 10-year anniversary of the first Patriot League championship team in program history. The 2007-08 team also earned the program’s first appearance in the Division I NCAA tournament.

February 3, 2018 – Head women’s basketball coach Megan Gebbia is inducted into her hometown Frederick County Sports Hall of Fame.

February 14, 2018 – Emily Kinneston reaches 1,000 career points as the women’s basketball team tops Boston University, 61-54, on the road. She is the 18th player in program history to reach the milestone.

February 17, 2018 – The women’s basketball team sets a new program record with 16 straight wins thanks to a 74-66 victory over Lafayette on Senior Day. The Eagles would stretch that mark to 17 before falling to Bucknell.

February 18, 2018 – Briana Belo wins the women’s indoor 800-meter run conference championship with a time of 2:12.12.

February 21, 2018 – With a 72-57 win over Holy Cross, the women’s basketball clinches the program’s sixth regular-season title. The Eagles also finished the regular-season home slate undefeated (13-0) for the first time since the 1970s.

February 28, 2018 – Lacrosse’s Erica Skowron sets single-game school records with 11 points and six assists in 19-8 victory over Howard.

March 2, 2018 – Megan Gebbia is named Patriot League Women’s Basketball Coach of the Year for the second time in her career, while Emily Kinneston is named Patriot League Women’s Basketball Player of the Year. Gebbia is the second AU women’s basketball coach to earn coach of the year twice and Kinneston is the fourth player in program history to be player of the year

March 4, 2018 – Josh Terao breaks the AU wrestling record for career technical falls in a 16-0 win over Jonathan Gomez of Princeton. Terao now has 14 technical falls, surpassing the record previously held by Steve Fittery (2009-11). He would end his career with 22 technical falls the following season.

March 6, 2018 – Four AU wrestlers (Gage Curry, Josh Terao, Michael Sprague, Brett Dempsey) earn at-large bids to the NCAA tournament and join Jeric Kasunic, who qualified with a fourth-place finish at the EIWA Championships. The five wrestlers heading to NCAAs are the most for AU since five went in 2012. Kasunic goes 1-2 at nationals and finishes 35-7 for the year, the third-most victories in a season. He also surpassed the 100-win plateau at EIWAs, becoming the 8th wrestler in program history to do so.

March 6, 2018 – Emily Kinneston becomes the second consecutive women’s basketball player to be voted the Patriot League Scholar-Athlete of the Year. She joins the elite group of four AU women's basketball players who have been selected for the prestigious award since American joined the league in 2000 - Crisler, Jen Dumiak (2015), Alexis Dobbs (2012, 2013, 2014) and Liz Hayes (2007, 2008).

March 11, 2018 - The top-seeded American University women's basketball team makes history once again, defeating No. 3-seed Navy, 58-49, in Bender Arena to win the program's second Patriot League title and a berth into the NCAA Tournament. The Eagles set or tied several school records during the 2018 season: Single-Season Victories (26), Single-Season Conference Victories (16, tied), Single-Season Conference Winning Pct. (.889, 16-2, tied), and Single-Season FG Attempts (1,861). In the NCAA tournament, AU fell to No. 3 seeded UCLA, 71-60, in Pauley Pavilion.

April 6, 2018 – Briana Belo breaks her own school record in the women’s 800-meter run, leading the 69-woman field at the Colonial Relays with a final time of 2:07.52.

April 11, 2018 – Andre Ingram, Class of 2007, shines in a dream debut for the Los Angeles Lakers, scoring 19 points on 6-of-8 shooting, including 4-of-5 from three-point range. He became the oldest American-born rookie in the NBA since at least 1964. His performance garnered significant media attention from outlets including the New York Times, Washington Post, and TNT.

April 20, 2018 – Four AU wrestlers are named NWCA Academic All-Americans (Brett Dempsey, Jeric Kasunic, Michael Sprague, Josh Terao). Sprague and Terao are earning the national honor for the second straight season, becoming the 10th and 11th Eagles to win the honor at least twice. The Eagles earned a 3.44 GPA, marking the 12th time in the past 13 seasons AU has finished among the top 10 in the nation as they finished fourth in the country.

April 28, 2018 – Sophomore lacrosse player Erica Skowron breaks program record for single-season assists with 25.

May 7, 2018 - Emily Kinneston (women’s basketball) and Jeric Kasunic (wrestling) earn the Outstanding Senior Athlete awards. Brett Dempsey won the Barbara J. Reimann Scholarship.

May 17, 2018 – Four AU teams earned Public Recognition Awards from the NCAA as women's cross country, women's track, women's basketball and women's swimming and diving were among the top 10 percent among their sport nationally in the most recent Academic Progress Rate metric.

May 24, 2018 - For the first time since 2013, the American University track & field team will have two qualifiers into the NCAA Championships East Preliminary Round, as senior Brianna Belo (800m) and junior Matthew Rainey (1500m) both advanced into the first round of the national championship. Belo once again breaks her own school record in the 800-meter run.

Summer, 2018 – Jacobs Complex undergoes renovations, including an upgrade to the existing turf and a new Daktronics video board featuring an LED video display for in-game graphics content.

July 20, 2018 – Jenna Petrucelli is announced as the new head lacrosse coach. She is the eighth head coach in program history.

August 22, 2018 – Emily Kinneston (women’s basketball) is selected as the Patriot League's sole nominee for the 2018 NCAA Woman of the Year Award. Kinneston is one of 154 nominees nationwide, including 58 from Division I, to advance to the second round of the selection process.

August 26, 2018 – 2,837 fans attend the “Bender Blue Out” as AU volleyball drops a match to No. 1 Stanford, marking the largest crowd to see a home match for the Eagles. The crowd was the eighth in AU history to reach 2,000 or more.

August 31, 2018 – AU field hockey claims a convincing road victory, 5-2, over No. 17 James Madison.

September 13, 2018 – Teague Moore returns to the international wrestling scene, as USA Wrestling announces his appointment as head coach of the U.S. Men’s Freestyle Junior World Team competing in Slovakia.

September 29, 2018 – Head field hockey coach Steve Jennings wins his 250th career game in a decisive 9-1 victory over Lehigh. He becomes the 14th active Division I field hockey coach (27th all-time) to reach the milestone.

October 1, 2018 - Head men's basketball coach Mike Brennan announces that Yilret "YY" Yiljep is medically cleared to resume all athletic activities and will compete for the Eagles in the 2018-19 season. The NCAA and Patriot League approve a waiver request granting him additional seasons of eligibility as a graduate student at AU. Yiljep has been part of the AU men's basketball program since the 2013-14 season when he took the court in 13 games as a freshman. His season and subsequent undergraduate career was cut short due to a heart condition.

October 29, 2018 – Yari Bradfield becomes the first AU women’s soccer player to be named Patriot League Offensive Player of the Year after leading the league in goals (13) and points (28).

October 31, 2018 – Maura Jacobs is chosen for her second consecutive Patriot League Field Hockey Scholar-Athlete of the Year honor. The Eagles have now earned the award for five consecutive years and nine total since joining the Patriot League in 2001. Jacobs was also named the PL Goalkeeper of the Year, joining Rafaela Rubas as PL major award winners. Rubas earned her second consecutive PL Offensive Player of the Year award.

November 9, 2018 – Sa’eed Nelson eclipses 1,000 career points in a 78-75 overtime road win over George Mason. Yilret Yiljep also returns to the lineup for the first since Jan. 8, 2014.

November 13, 2018 – Megan Gebbia signs a five-year contract extension to be the head women’s basketball coach through the 2023-24 season.

November 13, 2018 - Aleksandra Kazala is selected for the third straight season as the Patriot League Women’s Volleyball Player of the Year. Kazala becomes only the third player in PL history and the third Eagle to win the award three times. Karla Kucerkova (2001, 2002, 2003) and Rubena Sukaj (2006, 2007, 2008) are the other two.

November 17, 2018 – The quartet of Abby Longstaff, Eleanor Felton, Kyra Manson and Alex Brosvik post their second school record in three nights on Saturday when they earn a second-place finish in the women's 400-yard freestyle relay in the Patriot Invitational swimming and diving meet. They went 3:28.17 in the relay on Saturday, cutting more than a second off the previous school record. The same foursome set the 200 free relay school record on Thursday.

November 19, 2018 – Cecily Carl becomes the 19th player in women’s basketball history to surpass the 1,000-point milestone. With this, Carl joins elite company as one of only three players to hit 1,000 points, 500 rebounds and 100 blocks in her career. Only Liz Leer (2007-11) and Kirsten Keller (1991-95) have done so.

December 4, 2018 - The accolades continue to roll in for American University field hockey senior Rafaela Rubas, as she was named to the NFHCA All-America Third Team. Rubas is the 14th player in program history to earn All-American status and the first since Grace Wilson in 2013.

December 11, 2018 – Director of Athletics and Recreation Dr. Billy Walker is added to the President’s Cabinet at American University. The president's cabinet is composed of the senior university administrators who serve as the university's officers and who report directly to the president.

December 21, 2018 – Zach Samol is announced as the 16th head men’s soccer coach in the 60-year history of the program.

January 6, 2019 – Megan Gebbia picks up her 100th win as head women’s basketball coach at AU in a decisive 76-57 victory over Colgate.

January 16, 2019 – Josephine Harrington is promoted to deputy director of athletics.

January 16, 2019 – Steve Jennings signs contract extension to remain head field hockey coach through the 2023 season.

January 17, 2019 – Fiona Caulfield (women’s swimming and diving) is honored as one of five recipients of the 2018-19 NCAA Student-Athlete Sportsmanship Awards. The awards recognize the athletes and administrators who exemplify sportsmanship, a core principle of the NCAA. Caulfield went to the aid of an injured teammate at the 2018 Patriot League Championships instead of mentally preparing for her next dive. Her sacrifice left her only a few minutes to prepare, and she narrowly missed her chance for a podium spot at the final collegiate meet of her career.

January 22, 2019 – For the 47th consecutive semester, both the men’s and women’s swimming and diving teams are honored as Scholar All-America Teams. American's women combined for a 3.65 GPA, with the men posting a 3.26 in the fall 2018 semester.

February 2, 2019 – Cecily Carl sets a new women’s basketball program record with 37 points in a 71-66 win over Colgate. She went 10-of-20 from the field, 4-of-9 from three-point range, and 13-of-14 from the free throw line. With the effort, she surpasses Kirsten Keller's 36 points on Dec. 8, 1993.

February 14, 2019 - Academic recognitions continue to roll in for the American University cross country program, as both the men and women were selected as All-Academic Teams. To be eligible for an All-Academic award, a team must have started at least five runners at an NCAA Division I Regional cross country meet and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. The men's team closed the semester with a 3.34 cumulative GPA, while the women put up a department-high with a 3.65.

February 22, 2019 - Senior Scott Callander breaks his own school record in the men's 100-yard butterfly on Friday, finishing sixth in the championship final at the 2019 Patriot League Swimming and Diving Championships hosted by Bucknell.

February 27, 2019 - Lily Koenig goes 56.20 in the women's 100-yard backstroke to set a new Frailey Pool record as the AU swimming and diving teams end their season in the annual Eagle Invitational. Koenig's mark smashed the previous record of 57.71, set by AU's Paris Wood in Oct. 2015.

March 6, 2019 – Women’s basketball earns a share of the Patriot League regular-season title, but are seeded No. 2 after being swept by co-champ Bucknell.

March 8, 2019 – Cecily Carl becomes the fifth player in program history to be selected as the Patriot League Women’s Basketball Player of the Year.

March 9, 2019 – Josh Terao reaches the EIWA finals for the second time and finishes as runner-up. He led a group of four AU wrestlers who earned berths to the NCAA Championships (Gage Curry, Michael Sprague, Terao and Tanner Harvey). Terao becomes the 7th Eagle to qualify for NCAAs three times. As a team, the Eagles scored 75.5 points at the conference meet, which is the most for the program in the last seven seasons.

March 12, 2019 – For the seventh time in eight years, an American University women's basketball player has been selected as the Patriot League Scholar-Athlete of the Year, as senior Cecily Carl was awarded the honor less than a week after earning Patriot League Player of the Year.

March 17, 2019 – Women’s basketball falls in a hard-fought game to Bucknell in the Patriot League championship, 66-54. American qualifies for the WNIT and travel to the historic Palestra on the campus of Penn. It is the Eagles’ 7th appearance in the WNIT.

March 22, 2019 – Josh Terao finishes his AU career in his third appearance at the NCAA Championships, winning a match to finish his career with 103 wins. He is the 9th wrestler in program history to reach 100 wins and ends his career in 6th place on the all-time wins list.

April 26, 2019 – Five American University student-athletes are honored with 2019 Arthur Ashe Jr. Sports Scholar Awards by "Diverse: Issues in Higher Education" magazine. Sam Fromkin, Arianna Lopez, Gabriela Maldonado, Justin Perez and Matthew Rainey earned recognition from the magazine.

April 28, 2019 - Aleksandra Kazala (volleyball) and Josh Terao (wrestling) earn Outstanding Female and Male Senior Athlete Awards. Women's soccer player Audrey Denkler is the recipient of the Barbara J. Reimann Postgraduate Scholarship.

April 29, 2019 – Emma Vinall finishes lacrosse season with program-record 65 points and is named Second Team All-Patriot League.

April 30, 2019 – Four AU wrestlers (Josh Terao, Kizhan Clarke, Michael Sprague, Jack Mutchnik) are named NWCA Scholar All-Americans and the team finishes second in the NCAA for team GPA (3.56). The 3.56 GPA is the best posted at AU since the academic performance started to be tracked in 2006 (3.48, 2011).

May 1, 2019 - Four teams at American University earn Public Recognition Awards from the NCAA based on their Academic Progress Rate results. Men's soccer, women's cross country, women's track and field, and women's swimming & diving each earned a perfect 1,000 score in the APR metric. The APR is an annual scorecard of academic achievement calculated for all Division I teams. Public Recognition Awards are given to the top 10 percent of teams in each sport in terms of APR.

May 4, 2019 - American University track & field senior Adriana Hooks highlighted the Patriot League Championship meet for the Eagles squad with two podium finishes, including the program's first-ever title in the women's 10,000-meter run.

May 13, 2019 – A group of 17 student-athletes, plus three staff members, head to to the small rural community of Tercera Linea, Paraguay, from May 13-22 to assist community members in the construction of a multipurpose sports court. The trip is organized by the Student-Athlete Support Program.

May 24, 2019 - Senior Liam Purdy closes his American University track & field career in style on Friday, earning the highest finish ever for an AU runner at the NCAA Championships East Preliminary Round with an 18th-place finish in the 800-meter run.

June 11, 2019 – Meg Gebbia extends her contract another season, keeping her under contact with AU through 2025.

June 11, 2019 – Two AU field hockey players are chosen to compete in the 2019 Young Women's National Championship (YWNC) as rising sophomore Josie Formica and Natalie Konerth ('17) were among the 144 elite collegiate and post-collegiate athletes selected for the prestigious tournament.

June 25, 2019 - The College Swimming and Diving Coaches Association of America recognizes American University's men's and women's squads as Scholar All-America Teams for the Spring 2019 semester. The honor marked the 49th consecutive semester that both the men's and women's teams at AU have earned Scholar All-America Team status. The men's team earned a 3.28 for the semester, while the women were at 3.58.

August 6, 2019 - 2019 American University field hockey graduate Rafaela Rubas is selected as one of the two Patriot League nominees for the NCAA Woman of the Year Award.

August 22, 2019 – Mike Brennan signs a contract extension to remain the head men’s basketball coach through the 2021-22 season.

September 12, 2019 – Karen Angell joins AU Athletics as Assistant AD for Communications and Digital Media.

September, 2019 – AU receives two generous gifts in support of a new Center for Athletic Performance to enhance the student-athlete experience. AU Board of Trustees member Jack Cassell, and his wife, Denise, gave $3 million, and fellow Board of Trustees member, Alan Meltzer, and his wife, Amy, gave $5 million. The Meltzers also gave $2 million to create the Alan L. Meltzer and Amy Meltzer Fellowship for CIS (Center for Israel Studies).

October 16, 2019 - AU ranks in the top 25 of all Division I athletic departments in the latest NCAA Graduation Success Rate (GSR) data release. The NCAA Graduation Success Rate (GSR) is designed to reflect the proportion of student-athletes on any given team who earn a college degree within a six-year window of their initial enrollment.

November 1, 2019 - Senior Kristen Largay becomes the new all-time leader in career digs for American University volleyball. She would go on to finish her career with 2,012 digs, which also is first in Patriot League history.

November 2, 2019 – Field hockey holds off Lafayette to win its first regular-season PL title since 2013. The Eagles also finish conference play unbeaten at 6-0.

November 5, 2019 – Junior Noor Coenen is chosen as the Patriot League Field Hockey Player of the Year. It’s the third straight season an AU player has brought the award back to Tenleytown.

November 10, 2019 – Field hockey overcomes an early deficit to beat Lafayette, 3-2, and win the program’s 11th Patriot League championship. Noor Coenen is named Tournament MVP after tying a tournament record with four goals and nine points. AU would travel to take on Fairfield in an NCAA Opening Round game, falling in a tight contest, 3-1.

November 12, 2019 – Sa’eed Nelson hits a short jumper as time expires to top A-10 opponent, and city rival, George Wasington. The play reaches No. 2 on ESPN’s SportsCenter Top 10, the first of three AU men’s basketball plays to reach the countdown during the 2019-20 season (Stacy Beckton Jr. dunk against Lehigh in January, Connor Nelson buzzer-beater against Bucknell in January)

November 18, 2019 – Women’s basketball tops High Point, 56-48, on the team’s first Pride Night. The game celebrated Pride and inclusivity in the extended AU community, as the campus continues its work to develop a sense of belonging for all.

November 21, 2019 – Volleyball brings home three major conference awards. Olivia Wassner is named the Patriot League Scholar-Athlete of the Year and Setter of the Year, while Zynep Uzen is recognized as the PL Rookie of the Year.

November 24, 2019 – For the 16th time in 19 years, volleyball wins the Patriot League title and qualifies for the NCAA tournament. AU picked up a four-set victory over Army for its 17th straight win. The Eagles would travel to State College, Pa., to take on CAA champ Towson in the first round, falling in a five-set heartbreaker to the Tigers.

December 7, 2019 – Kizhan Clarke (wrestling) opens his season by winning four straight tournaments and racing out to a 17-0 record. He would be ranked as high as No. 7 during the 2019-20 season.

December 10, 2019 – Noor Coenen (field hockey) becomes the 15th player in program history to be named an All-American as she was named to the Second Team by the NFHCA.

December 29, 2019 – Marsha Harper is named the seventh head coach in AU women’s soccer history.

December 30, 2019 – Kizhan Clarke finishes fifth at the prestigious Midlands Championships, while Sal Profaci finishes in eighth place.
